author: Olivia Waring
title: TV presenter eats human brain on camera as he meets cannibal tribe who snack on their own poo
text:
A TV presenter shocked the world by eating human brain for his show (Pictures: CNN) A brave TV investigator has been seen eating human brain after having human ashes wiped on him and drinking booze out of a human skull. 
20 years of Buffy The Vampire Slayer: 14 reasons why we still love Joss Whedon’s supernatural show Poor Reza Aslan then had human faeces hurled at his face by an angry tribesman — who’d been munching on it out of his hand.
To top it all, the Iranian-American TV presenter — filming for his CNN show Believer — didn’t even enjoy the taste of human brain, saying it tasted like ‘charcoal’.
Pooing into your own hand so you can eat it immediately? Why not (Picture: CNN) Commenting on the taste of the brain, Aslan joked: ‘Want to know what a dead guy’s brain tastes like? Charcoal.
‘It was burnt to a crisp!’
Maybe you should have sent it back and asked for medium-rare?
Aslan waits for his meal (Picture: CNN) Complaining only got him into deep water with one of the less friendly nomads, who told him (through mouthfuls of poo): ‘I will cut your head off if you keep talking so much.’
The man then angrily threw his own faeces at Aslan and his crew, who swiftly moved out of the way.
Aslan, right, gets a telling off (Picture: CNN) Aslan, who’s a Muslim, admitted to being shocked at the behaviour of the sect of Hindu nomads in India called the Aghori, who he was visiting in Varanasi, India for an episode of the programme.
He told viewers: ‘I feel like this may have been a mistake.’

The Aghori reject the Hindu caste system and believe the human body cannot be tainted, and Hindu viewers are not happy that their religion has been linked to their culture on TV.
The rather unpalatable episode features in Believer (Picture: CNN) Trump-supporting business magnate Shalabh Kumar has called the show a ‘disgusting attack on Hinduism’ online.
But Aslan hit back on Twitter: ‘This is a show about the Aghori not Hinduism.’
Aslan is one brave motherflipper (Picture: Getty) Viewers were rather startled. Watching #Believer … in a way the Aghori have a good philosophy… then they eat dead people, their own poo and such. That's weird.
— not kenny friedman (@smonkyou) March 6, 2017 
#RussiaGate 
Mr. Prez, I have a tribe I'd like you to visit. The Aghori tribe in India has invited you to dinner.
— Andrea (@mirakle330) March 6, 2017 
Aslan gets cremated human ashes smeared on his mug (Picture: CNN) Heh heh, CNN will be in trouble with a billion Hindus who condemn cannibalism to the 100 who practice it, how could he eat a human brain.
— Wishspell (@Wishspell_) March 10, 2017 

High-protein diets are all the rage right now but isn’t this taking it a little too far?
